1import argparse 

2import os 

3import requests 

4from huggingface_hub import HfApi 

5 

6def update_model_card(repo_name, model_card_path=None, model_type="standard"): 

7 """ 

8 Update the model card for a model on Hugging Face Hub 

9  

10 Args: 

11 repo_name (str): Name of the repository on Hugging Face Hub 

12 model_card_path (str, optional): Path to model card markdown file 

13 model_type (str): Type of model - "standard" or "improved" 

14 """ 

15 # Initialize Hugging Face API 

16 api = HfApi() 

17 

18 # If no model card path provided, create one 

19 if model_card_path is None: 

20 model_card = create_model_card(repo_name, model_type) 

21 model_card_path = "temp_model_card.md" 

22 with open(model_card_path, "w") as f: 

23 f.write(model_card) 

24 else: 

25 # Read the model card from file 

26 with open(model_card_path, "r") as f: 

27 model_card = f.read() 

28 

29 # Upload the model card 

30 api.upload_file( 

31 path_or_fileobj=model_card_path, 

32 path_in_repo="README.md", 

33 repo_id=repo_name, 

34 repo_type="model", 

35 ) 

36 

37 # Clean up temporary file if created 

38 if model_card_path == "temp_model_card.md" and os.path.exists(model_card_path): 

39 os.remove(model_card_path) 

40 

41 print(f"Model card updated for {repo_name}") 

42 

43def create_model_card(repo_name, model_type="standard"): 

44 """Create a detailed model card""" 

45 

46 # Performance metrics based on model type 

47 if model_type == "improved": 

48 accuracy = "86.50%" 

49 f1_score = "0.8672" 

50 precision = "84.21%" 

51 recall = "89.47%" 

52 model_description = "This is an improved version of the sentiment analysis model, fine-tuned with additional challenging examples to handle difficult cases like negation, sarcasm, and subtle expressions." 

53 model_version = "2.0" 

54 training_details = "The model was trained on the IMDB dataset augmented with challenging examples specifically designed to improve performance on difficult sentiment analysis cases." 

55 else: 

56 accuracy = "84.00%" 

57 f1_score = "0.8462" 

58 precision = "81.48%" 

59 recall = "88.00%" 

60 model_description = "This is a fine-tuned DistilBERT model for sentiment analysis on the IMDB movie reviews dataset." 

61 model_version = "1.0" 

62 training_details = "The model was trained on the IMDB dataset using supervised fine-tuning." 

63 

64 # Create the model card with proper escaping for code examples 

65 model_card = f"""--- 

66language: en 

67license: mit 

68library_name: transformers 

69tags: 

70- sentiment-analysis 

71- text-classification 

72- pytorch 

73- distilbert 

74- imdb 

75datasets: 

76- imdb 

77metrics: 

78- accuracy 

79- f1 

80- precision 

81- recall 

82model-index: 

83- name: {repo_name.split('/')[-1]} 

84 results: 

85 - task: 

86 type: text-classification 

87 name: Text Classification 

88 dataset: 

89 name: IMDB 

90 type: imdb 

91 split: test 

92 metrics: 

93 - type: accuracy 

94 value: {accuracy.replace('%', '')} 

95 name: Accuracy 

96 - type: f1 

97 value: {f1_score} 

98 name: F1 Score 

99--- 

100 

101# Sentiment Analysis Model v{model_version} 

102 

103{model_description} 

104 

105## Model Details 

106 

107- **Model Type:** DistilBERT (fine-tuned) 

108- **Task:** Binary Sentiment Classification (Positive/Negative) 

109- **Training Data:** IMDB Movie Reviews Dataset 

110- **Language:** English 

111- **License:** MIT 

112- **Version:** {model_version} 

113 

114## Performance 

115 

116| Metric | Value | 

117|--------|-------| 

118| Accuracy | {accuracy} | 

119| F1 Score | {f1_score} | 

120| Precision | {precision} | 

121| Recall | {recall} | 

122 

123## Training Details 

124 

125{training_details} 

126 

127### Training Hyperparameters 

128 

129- Learning Rate: 2e-5 

130- Batch Size: 16 (effective batch size: 32 with gradient accumulation) 

131- Epochs: 3 

132- Optimizer: AdamW with weight decay 

133- Mixed Precision: FP16 

134 

135## Usage 

136 

137### Direct Use with Pipeline 

138 

139```python 

140from transformers import pipeline 

141 

142# Load the model 

143sentiment = pipeline("sentiment-analysis", model="{repo_name}") 

144 

145# Analyze text 

146result = sentiment("I really enjoyed this movie!") 

147print(result) # [{ 'label': 'POSITIVE', 'score': 0.9998} ] 

148 

149# Batch processing 

150texts = [ 

151 "This movie was absolutely amazing, I loved every minute of it!", 

152 "The acting was terrible and the plot made no sense at all." 

153] 

154results = sentiment(texts) 

155for i, (text, result) in enumerate(zip(texts, results)): 

156 print(f"Text: { { text} } ") 

157 print(f"Sentiment: { { result['label']} } , Score: { { result['score']:.4f} } ") 

158``` 

159 

160### Loading Model Directly 

161 

162```python 

163from transformers import AutoModelForSequenceClassification, AutoTokenizer 

164import torch 

165 

166# Load model and tokenizer 

167model_name = "{repo_name}" 

168model = AutoModelForSequenceClassification.from_pretrained(model_name) 

169tokenizer = AutoTokenizer.from_pretrained(model_name) 

170 

171# Prepare text 

172text = "I really enjoyed this movie!" 

173inputs = tokenizer(text, return_tensors="pt", truncation=True, padding=True) 

174 

175# Get prediction 

176with torch.no_grad(): 

177 outputs = model(**inputs) 

178  

179# Process outputs 

180probabilities = torch.nn.functional.softmax(outputs.logits, dim=-1) 

181prediction = torch.argmax(probabilities, dim=-1).item() 

182confidence = probabilities[0][prediction].item() 

183 

184# Map prediction to label (0: negative, 1: positive) 

185sentiment_label = "POSITIVE" if prediction == 1 else "NEGATIVE" 

186print(f"Sentiment: { { sentiment_label} } , Confidence: { { confidence:.4f} } ") 

187``` 

188 

189## Limitations 

190 

191- The model is trained primarily on movie reviews and may not perform as well on other domains. 

192- The model may struggle with certain types of text: 

193 - Sarcasm and irony 

194 - Mixed sentiment expressions 

195 - Subtle negative expressions 

196 - Complex negations 

197 

198## Citation 

199 

200If you use this model in your research, please cite: 

201 

202``` 

203@misc{ sentiment-analysis-model, 

204 author = { Your Name} , 

205 title = { Sentiment Analysis Model based on DistilBERT} , 

206 year = { 2023} , 

207 publisher = { Hugging Face} , 

208 howpublished = { \\url{ https://huggingface.co/{repo_name}} } 

209} 

210``` 

211""" 

212 return model_card 

213 

214def main(): 

215 parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description="Update model card on Hugging Face Hub") 

216 parser.add_argument("--repo_name", type=str, required=True, 

217 help="Repository name on Hugging Face Hub (e.g., username/model-name)") 

218 parser.add_argument("--model_card", type=str, default=None, 

219 help="Path to model card markdown file") 

220 parser.add_argument("--improved", action="store_true", 

221 help="Use improved model card template") 

222 args = parser.parse_args() 

223 

224 model_type = "improved" if args.improved else "standard" 

225 update_model_card(args.repo_name, args.model_card, model_type) 

226 

227if __name__ == "__main__": 

228 main()
